definition: (of a man) to dress as a woman (idiom)
male/Baron, lowest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/CL:個|个[ge4]
to disguise oneself as/to dress up/to play (a role)/to put on (an expression)
archaic variant of 汝[ru3]
female/woman/daughter
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack

sentences.english: According to a police report, Burrow was dressed as a woman and wearing a wig.
sentences.chinese: 根據警方報告，柏洛男扮女裝，還戴假髮。

sentences.english: Shawn and Marlon Wayans According to the movies, FBI agents are always dressing in drag.
sentences.chinese: 通過電影會發現FBI探員經常男扮女裝。

sentences.english: The first time I dressed up as a woman was Hallowe'en1).
sentences.chinese: 我第一次男扮女裝是在一次萬聖節前夕。

sentences.english: He disguised himself as a girl with a false long hair.
sentences.chinese: 他戴上假長髮套男扮女裝。

sentences.english: The first time I dressed up as a woman was Hallowe'en.
sentences.chinese: 我第一次男扮女裝是在一次萬聖節前夕。

sentences.english: According to the movies, FBI agents are always dressing in drag.
sentences.chinese: 通過電影會發現FBI探員經常男扮女裝。

definition: contemporary drama
lit. to hate iron for not becoming steel/to feel resentful towards sb for failing to meet expectations and impatient to see improvement (idiom)
shameless
lit. the soul of a deceased has not yet dispersed (idiom)/fig. the influence still lingers on/the spirit (of some doctrine) is still alive
(of a woman) to dress as a man (idiom)
to step down gracefully (humble expression)/to concede defeat/to play second fiddle
to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
to masturbate
profound mystery
to massacre one another (idiom); internecine strife
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
calm and composed (idiom)
brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
pampered son of a wealthy family
